item.title: gghighlight: Highlight ggplot's Lines and Points with Predicates
item.description: Suppose we have a data that has too many series like this: set.seed(2) d <- purrr::map_dfr( letters, ~ data.frame(idx = 1:400, value = cumsum(runif(400, -1, 1)), type = ., stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) For such data, it is almost impossible to identify a series by its colour as their differences are so subtle. library(ggplot2) ggplot(d) + geom_line(aes(idx, value, colour = type)) So, I am motivated to filter data and map colour only on that, using dplyr:
